title: 15 die of flash floods in western U.S. state
content:
LOS ANGELES, Sept 16 (Xinhua) -- Fifteen people, including six children, were killed in flash flooding hitting the U.S. western state of Utah, officials said Tuesday.

Among the dead, 12 were from two families were stranded on Monday in two vehicles and caught off guard by the raging waters in the town of Hildale.

Related: TOKYO, Sept. 15 (Xinhua) -- All 15 people who were reportedly missing in flooding last week in Japan's Joso city, north of Tokyo, have been confirmed safe, local media reported Tuesday.

The Ibaraki Prefecture, where the Kinugawa River burst its banks last Thursday, had reported 15 people missing as of Saturday morning. However, all the people have been found safe until Tuesday afternoon, said Japan's Kyodo News Agency. Full story
